page.title: 06THE COOPERS ARMS
page.content: The Coopers Arms is a pub in Barthomew street. It is a tenanted pub owned by Courage Breweries. Mr Saunders,the tenant,looks after the pub and employs twelve part-timers. The price of drinks has trebled in the past ten years.A measure of whisky costs 60p and a pint of lager 79p. Fashions have changed over the years;bitter beer is less popular and lager more so.Also beer comes in metal kegs instead of barrels.These are much easier to work with but the beer is more gassy.The pub opens from 10.30am to 2.30pm and then closes,and opens from 5.30pm to 11.00pm. The tenant has to have a licence to sell spirits and has to maintain a certain standard of hygiene. The pub building has been standing for 350 years but hasn't always been a pub. Supplies are delivered once a week.
